content:
Swiming 
 Alice Inzikuru 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Once upon a time there 
 
 lived two friends, Tortoise 
 
 and Snake. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 On day Tortoise said to Snake, “Let us go and swim.” 
 
 “Alright, but I don’t know to swim,” answered Snake. 
 
 “I wil teach you,” replied Tortoise. 
 
 2  
 
 
 They went to a swiming pol. “Who wil enter the water first?” asked 
 
 Tortoise. 
 
 “You wil, and I wil watch you,” said Snake. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 Tortoise entered the swiming pol. Snake observed from the steps. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 After some time, Snake entered the pol as Tortoise gave 
 
 instructions. 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 Tortoise and Snake swam in the shalow end of the pol. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They started floating on the water. 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As they were floating, 
 
 Tortoise started swiming 
 
 backstroke. While imitating 
 
 Tortoise, Snake could not 
 
 propel himself and started 
 
 drowning. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 On realising that Snake had disapeared, Tortoise huriedly went 
 
 under water and rescued the life of the snake. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As son as Tortoise got 
 
 out of the water, he turned 
 
 Snake upside-down in 
 
 order to get rid of the water 
 
 that Snake swalowed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Finaly, Tortoise used the mouth-to-mouth method to remove more 
 
 water. 
 
 
 1
